data.text: (THREAD) Congratulations to the winners of our first scholarship for women in economics: Míde Griffin, Maja Saboland, Camille Habe (not pictured), Annik Ketterle and Karolina Wilczyńska! We are proud to support your master’s degree studies. 1/3 https://t.co/0NC8ydpWqk

What can be done to improve the profitability of European banks? More consolidation and a more integrated banking union are part of the answer, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria. Read the full interview with him in our latest Supervision Newsletter https://t.co/0kgO66llQZ https://t.co/g71OAeESnl

The ECB aims to keep inflation below, but close to, 2% over the medium term. What does “over the medium term” mean and why is it important? @MichaelSteen discusses this with ECB Chief Economist Philip R. Lane in the second episode of The ECB #Podcast https://t.co/GmndRhAiOx https://t.co/uppg4vurGO

More European-level arrangements are the right way forward, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria at the #ECBForum, when asked about potentially replacing bank insolvency procedures with resolution processes. Find out more here https://t.co/lviCm9c8ZH https://t.co/Ed7wFC3UJQ

How can ageing populations affect inflation? In the second episode of The ECB #Podcast, @MichaelSteen talks to ECB expert Christiane Nickel about the effects demographics can have on inflation. Listen here https://t.co/CuA2FCkkLt https://t.co/dkIz5Uyef5

How will technology transform the banking sector? What challenges does digital transformation pose for banks and supervisors? Tune in for today’s panel at the #ECBForum on Banking Supervision to find out. Watch live from 15:45 CET https://t.co/354x7VkBZS https://t.co/MiJu6jxAY2
Consolidated Banking Data for end-June 2019 https://t.co/RZDvCYOisT
Correct information: Olivier Guersent is affiliated to the European Commission (not ClassCnbc). Apologies for the mistake in the visual above.

Is the current framework for bank crisis management complete? And, if not, what remains to be done? Tune in from 14:00 CET today to watch our panellists discuss these and other questions at the #ECBForum on Banking Supervision https://t.co/fD7vxaSftp https://t.co/fRaKfKMoiq
Working group on euro risk-free rates issues high level recommendations for fallback provisions in contracts referencing EURIBOR https://t.co/OZlbNc0O1C
Working paper: Global value chain participation and exchange rate pass-through https://t.co/Gwt9N9AYAD
Economic Bulletin article: Trends in central banks’ foreign currency reserves and the case of the ECB https://t.co/w9AxjUVqdx

Should banks expect more regulatory reforms in the future? What legislative challenges do banks and regulators currently face? Watch today’s panel at the #ECBForum on Banking Supervision for the answers to these questions. Panel starts shortly – tune in https://t.co/fD7vxaSftp https://t.co/oLPa8bFPm2

Andrea Enria: Single European supervision also requires single European regulation. We do have a single European rulebook for banks, but it is not as harmonised as it should be. We need to harmonise regulation further, and sooner rather than later https://t.co/lCuumqJ2lT 4/4

Andrea Enria: We still need to erect the third pillar of the banking union: European deposit insurance. Depositors must be sure that their money is well protected, no matter whether it is deposited with a bank in France, Italy, Greece or Germany. 3/4
Andrea Enria: European banking supervision helped banks to repair their balance sheets more quickly after the crisis. Banks now have much stronger capital and liquidity positions. 2/4

(THREAD) European banking supervision is only five years old but is now well established and has become an irreversible feature of our institutional environment, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria at the #ECBForum on Banking Supervision https://t.co/lCuumqJ2lT 1/4 https://t.co/a24s6FJkWc

November 2014 was a crossroads for the euro area banking sector. The creation of the Single Supervisory Mechanism gave the ECB micro- and macroprudential responsibilities, says ECB Vice-President Luis de Guindos at the #ECBForum on Banking Supervision https://t.co/cd56sCuL5P https://t.co/ZvRDhNMnVS

Watch the third #ECBForum on Banking Supervision live from 10:00 CET today. We will be discussing modern technology, crisis management, governance and ethics, and rules and regulation https://t.co/fD7vxaSftp https://t.co/2QhBagb7Pd

Today we welcome Christine @Lagarde as the new ECB President. We wish her all the best for her eight-year term of office. https://t.co/5wYqx0iGVG
We thank Mario Draghi for his leadership over the past eight years and wish him the very best for the future (9/9) https://t.co/zDUZ4EJF9s

RECOVERY FOR EUROPE: Our measures achieve results:
➡️more than 11 million new jobs since 2012 
➡️sustained economic growth for several years

How can we ensure future growth? We need to strengthen our Union, Mario Draghi emphasised in his final interview as ECB President (8/9) https://t.co/IlSbzHAIne

NOT THE ONLY GAME IN TOWN: While the ECB can contribute to economic growth through monetary policy, other policy areas also need to play their part. Mario Draghi reiterated this on many occasions (7/9) https://t.co/Uu9xpEM4nx

STARTING FORWARD GUIDANCE: The ECB began to provide information about its future monetary policy intentions – a tool known as forward guidance. Mario Draghi described forward guidance as a major monetary policy tool (6/9) https://t.co/KHEgVyZzMM

MODERNISING OUR TOOLKIT: Under Mario Draghi’s leadership, the Governing Council deployed new tools to help achieve our mandate of price stability, including asset purchases and long-term lending operations for banks (5/9) https://t.co/YqOnRVimSv

A STRONG ADVOCATE FOR A BETTER EUROPE: European banking supervision was neither the start, nor the end of the reforms needed in Europe to restore stability and return to prosperity, said Mario Draghi one year after the ECB started supervising banks in Europe (4/9) https://t.co/jIzpgX79mW
A SUPPORTER OF MULTILATERALISM: Mario Draghi stressed that we must work together across national boundaries to respond to worries about fairness, safety and equality (3/9) https://t.co/TBmZX83htk

COMMITTED TO THE CURRENCY: Mario Draghi’s term was marked by the financial crisis. He is said to have saved the euro with his famous words #whateverittakes. At a time of concern, his words reassured Europeans of the ECB’s steadfast commitment to the single currency (2/9) https://t.co/l7Dr1oUU7D
(THREAD) With Mario Draghi’s presidency coming to an end today, we look back at the past eight years and some of the key themes from his time as ECB President (1/9) https://t.co/StXXeyRmPR

Inflation means prices go up – so how can this be a good thing? @MichaelSteen and guests discuss this and other key questions in episode two of The ECB #Podcast. Listen, subscribe and let us know what you think https://t.co/eBO0wF2IfO https://t.co/34ge0Kn5h2
Andrea Enria: I believe the most urgent priorities that the banking union faced have been addressed. Banks’ capital is of a better quality. 3/4
Andrea Enria: The best advertisement for the banking union is that we now have two more EU countries on track to join the club: Bulgaria and Croatia. 2/4

(THREAD) The banking union is the necessary complement to the single currency, says Supervisory Board Chair Andrea Enria in a speech at the Centre for European Reform in London https://t.co/vw1jL1JfIR 1/4 https://t.co/TM6QRymROj

@bankofengland @federalreserve @bankofcanada Keep an eye out for highlights of the discussions, the research papers and more photos on our website https://t.co/IfaONYqv0r #gender #economics #womenineconomics https://t.co/9vd6XJmX1e
@bankofengland @federalreserve Next year’s conference will be hosted by the @federalreserve, and the @bankofcanada will also help organise it. https://t.co/w5ltC2nuf9

The latest research on the gender gap in economics and discussions on how to close it were on the agenda at our second conference on gender and career progression, which we organised together with the @bankofengland and the @federalreserve . Thank you to all who participated! https://t.co/5GMIepup8E

The #ECBForum on Banking Supervision takes place in a week’s time. The topic is “Banking at a crossroads: resilience and innovation in an era of uncertainty”. Check out the programme and watch live on 6 November https://t.co/UWJ5ZJL2vd https://t.co/B6DwAav4Ks
Interview Andrea Enria with Radio Nacional https://t.co/5aaWh8Vccu (EN) https://t.co/bHO5kxylbi (ES)

@EmmanuelMacron @Lagarde @Quirinale And finally, President Draghi stressed the ECB’s independence, achievements and focus on its mandate. He expressed his sense of honour for the privilege of having served as ECB President. Read his full speech here https://t.co/1vy13sUuC8 https://t.co/teFqtBYIHD

@EmmanuelMacron @Lagarde @Quirinale Incoming ECB President Christine @Lagarde described President Draghi’s legacy as a call for excellence. She thanked him for serving Europe and its citizens with wisdom, determination and commitment. https://t.co/uovWtHdKCn
@EmmanuelMacron @Lagarde German Chancellor Angela Merkel said the euro is more than a currency and symbolises the irreversibility of European integration. https://t.co/YsZv44daBy
@EmmanuelMacron @Lagarde French President @EmmanuelMacron credited President Draghi with saving the euro. https://t.co/EQJT4uaorq

Mario Draghi’s eight-year term of office draws to a close this week. Yesterday Chancellor Angela Merkel, President @EmmanuelMacron, President Sergio Mattarella and incoming ECB President Christine @Lagarde honoured his contribution to Europe and the euro. https://t.co/Ejzdud3izo

The annual growth rate of broad money (M3) in the euro area decreased to 5.5% in September 2019 from 5.8% in August (revised from 5.7%). Full press release https://t.co/WuZPiYa8r7 https://t.co/XKwfC97EwE

@EmmanuelMacron @Quirinale 📸 As we prepare to say goodbye to Mario Draghi, we have put together a photo album showing some of the key moments from his term of office. See the photo album here https://t.co/uxXEJMOO5l https://t.co/xL2Gjwl2sM

Later today we bid farewell to President Mario Draghi. German Chancellor Angela Merkel, French President @EmmanuelMacron and Italian President Sergio Mattarella (@Quirinale) are among those speaking. Watch live from 15:00 CET. https://t.co/qyloTIxQ0v

“Celebrating Europe” has been the theme of our Cultural Days this year, marking the 20th anniversary of the euro. Thank you to all who joined us in these celebrations! Next year’s events will feature Poland’s rich culture @nbppl More info soon https://t.co/gsNJcqXlWx https://t.co/k2RHnWDrvt

*our outstanding staff
Draghi: We all strive for transparency and candour. Yes to open and broader communication but it should be done with caution as you stray into the area of politics.
Draghi: National central banks are key to reach the public in a currency zone of 19 countries and they can and do do a lot more than we can
